The electricity market has utilities on the supply side and consumers on the demand side, with blockchain you can integrate consumers with renewable power assets like solar, wind into the local grid to act as Prosumers. The inherent de-centralized nature of blockchain technology allows to create a network of multiple nodes embedded into the electricity distribution grid creating a so called smart grid. The blockchain acts as the accounting ledger for such a grid storing the transaction records of production and consumption by each prosumer/consumer for billing purposes. This allows to create a more competitive market where the prices cannot be dictated by utilities alone.**EDIT**To further expand the above, consider a distribution grid with prepaid meters for consumers. Normally consumers would load the amount in the meter wallet based on their estimated consumption. They would thus buy the power from the utility at fixed rate and consume that many units until their wallet balance is exhausted.Now consider this in a blockchain scenario, you can replace the fiat with say an ERC-20 token, where each token is pegged to the price of 1 unit of electricity. You then define the smart contract which governs the use of the token. The network will have an infinite supply of these tokens, and while tokens can be bought or sold, the consumption of electricity units would deplete the tokens from the network, meaning they get destroyed and cannot be recovered.So within the grid, you have the power producing utility which produces say 1000 units daily and decides to sell the same at 10¢ per token, you the consumer who consumes 100 units daily, purchases these tokens from the utility and is allowed to consume that many units of electricity. Next, I move into your area and put up solar on my house that generates 150 units daily. I utilize the 100 units I need internally and export surplus power of 50units back into the grid for say 5¢ per token. Suddenly you now have an option to procure power at less rates, 50x10¢ from the utility and 50x5¢ from me your neighbor. Multiply this scenario 1000 fold and you now have a very dynamic and competitive market where the price can no longer be dictated by the utility, while giving a chance to those with renewable assets to capitalize on their investments.
